# Firebase Environment Variables Setup

Your .env file needs to contain the following variables with your actual Firebase credentials:

EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_API_KEY=your-api-key-here
EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID=your-project-id-here
EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_STORAGE_BUCKET=your-project-id.firebasestorage.app
EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_MESSAGING_SENDER_ID=your-messaging-sender-id-here
EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_MOBILE_SDK_APP_ID=your-app-id-here

# Optional (will be auto-generated if not provided):
EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_AUTH_DOMAIN=your-project-id.firebaseapp.com

## How to get these values:
1. Go to https://console.firebase.google.com/
2. Select your project (or create a new one)
3. Go to Project Settings (gear icon) > General tab
4. Scroll down to "Your apps" section
5. If you don't have a web app, click "Add app" > Web
6. Copy the config values:
   - apiKey -> EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_API_KEY
   - projectId -> EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_PROJECT_ID
   - storageBucket -> EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_STORAGE_BUCKET
   - messagingSenderId -> EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_MESSAGING_SENDER_ID
   - appId -> EXPO_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_MOBILE_SDK_APP_ID

## Important Notes:
- All variables MUST start with EXPO_PUBLIC_ to be accessible in Expo
- After updating .env, you MUST restart Expo (stop and start again)
- The .env file is gitignored and won't be committed
